info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER AND NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sarver, or 12 miles northwest of Vandergrift, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... McCandless Township, Plum, Hampton Township, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, O`hara Township, Oakmont, Fox Chapel, Arnold, Tarentum, and Natrona Heights. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 37 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
